name: Muruku
description: Murukku is a savory, crunchy snack from South India, known for its twisted or spiral shape.

name: Thattai
description: Thattai is a crispy, deep-fried South Indian snack, primarily made from rice flour and commonly prepared during festivals like Pongal and Deepavali.

name: Adhirasam
description: Adhirasam is a traditional South Indian sweet, especially popular in Tamil Nadu, made from rice flour and jaggery.

name: Rava laddu
description: Rava laddu is a South Indian Sweet made with semolina, sugar, ghee, cashews and raisins. Rava is the Indian term for semolina & laddu are sweet balls.

name: Somasu
description: Somasu, also known as Somas, Karchikai, Somasi, Karanji, or Kajjikayalu, is a traditional Indian sweet snack, often made during festivals like Diwali.

name: Porulvilangi Uruandai
description: Poruvilangi or Porulvilangi Uruandai is a healthy and nutritious sweet ball. The name Porulvilangai literally means that the ingredients are a mystery.

name: Cone Porulvilangi Uruandai
description: Poruvilangi or Porulvilangi Uruandai is a healthy and nutritious sweet ball. The name Porulvilangai literally means that the ingredients are a mystery.

name: Omapodi
description: Omapodi is a delicious and crispy south Indian snack of sev, laced with the delicate aroma and flavor of ajwain or carom seeds (known as omam in tamil language).
